item.title: Building blocks of LSM based key/value storage engines: WAL
item.description: The Write-Ahead Log (WAL) is a fundamental component of LSM-based key-value storage engines, ensuring data durability and enabling recovery from system failures. The concept is straightforward: a WAL is an append-only log file on disk. In an LSM-based storage engine, every write operation, whether it’s a single key-value pair or a transactional batch, is first recorded in the WAL before being added to the active memtable. This append-only nature of WALs allows for efficient sequential disk access.
